channel.title: BUscience
channel.description: This is an interleaved feed of the most recent entries from BUscience, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: NSF invests in BioFoundries to drive advances across science and engineering
item.description: The U.S. National Science Foundation has made five awards totaling $75 million to support the creation of five biofoundries that will spur innovation,...

item.title: Among Viking societies, Norway was much more violent than Denmark

item.title: Astronomers make the highest-resolution radio observations ever

item.title: Dark matter could have helped make supermassive black holes in the early universe
item.description: Supermassive black holes typically take billions of years to form. But the James Webb Space Telescope is finding them not that long after the Big Bang...

item.title: U.S. National Science Foundation investing $14.5M in inaugural Innovation in Two-Year College in STEM Education awards

item.title: Bacterial cells transmit memories to offspring
item.description: Bacterial cells can 'remember' brief, temporary changes to their bodies and immediate surroundings, a new study has found. And, although these changes...

item.title: This week with NSF Director Panchanathan
item.description: Last week, the US National Science Foundation made major strides in research, innovation and conservation, marked by key announcements and engagement ...

item.title: Dogs understand words from soundboard buttons
item.description: A new study reveals that dogs trained with soundboard buttons can indeed comprehend specific words, producing contextually appropriate responses.
